definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
at or in the very same.../suitable/adequate/fitting/proper/to replace/to regard as/to think/to pawn/(coll.) to fail (a student)
to be/to act as/manage/withstand/when/during/ought/should/match equally/equal/same/obstruct/just at (a time or place)/on the spot/right/just at

sentences.english: You ever think about the infield?
You're always asking questions. Did you ever think about becoming a newscaster?
sentences.chinese: 你總在問問題。你想過當一名新聞播間員嗎？

sentences.english: Palestinian legislator Mustafa Barghouti says it was excessive use of force.
sentences.chinese: 巴勒斯坦議員巴爾古提認爲以色列軍隊使用武力過當。

sentences.english: Be protective, but not to the point of being overprotective.
sentences.chinese: 要有保護欲，但不能保護過當。

sentences.english: Ever watch the display of a page's contents shift around erratically while the document is loading?
sentences.chinese: 你是否見過當文檔加載時其內容會顯示不規律的移動？

sentences.english: I have witnessed "flails" triggered by panic with the situation going from bad to worse.
sentences.chinese: 我經歷過當情況變得越來越糟時所觸發的連環恐慌。

definition: to sketch in light shades/to play down/to deemphasize (idiom)
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
bored/fed up with sth/sick of sth
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
wording/way of expressing something/turn of phrase/diction
to turn a blind eye to
